items.description: River Thame, Horsenden Stream and Chalgrove Brook

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thame, Horsenden Stream, Chalgrove Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels are high but stable on the River Thame as a result of recent rainfall. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected today, 09/07/2024, especially in the Thame area. 

Further rainfall is forecast today and overnight which has the potential to be heavy at times. We expect river levels to begin slowly falling but will remain high and sensitive to further rainfall over the coming days. 

We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 

This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 10/07/2024, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. 

River levels are slowly falling on the River Coln as a result of recent rainfall. Flooding of low lying land and roads remains possible today, 09/07/2024, especially in the Fairford area. 

Further rainfall is forecast today and overnight which has the potential to be heavy at times. We expect river levels to continue slowly falling but will remain high and sensitive to further rainfall over the coming days. 

We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 

This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 10/07/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower River Colne and Frays River

floodArea.county: Buckinghamshire, Greater London, Hertfordshire, Hillingdon, Slough, Surrey, Windsor and Maidenhead

items.message:
River levels remain high on the Lower River Colne today, Monday 8th July. Further rain is forecast overnight into the morning.
Flooding may continue to affect locations near the Colne, Frays, Wraysbury and Poyle Channel, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around Longford.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10am tomorrow, Tuesday 9th July, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message:
River levels are rising at the Deepmore Farm river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible this morning, 09/07/24.  We expect flooding to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. We expect river levels to rise until later this afternoon.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated by 17:00 on 09/07/24, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teign, River Bovey, River Lemon, River Kenn

items.message: Flooding is possible tonight Monday 08/07/2024. Heavy rainfall is forecast overnight in the River Teign area. This will cause river levels to rise with possible flooding to low lying land and roads close to rivers. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are constantly monitoring river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 09/07/2024, or earlier if the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message: Heavy rainfall is expected overnight and early tomorrow morning.  This could make the river levels rise quickly on all rivers and streams in the West Dorset area.  This rain will be falling on catchments that are mainly dry and therefore surface water runoff will occur.  Flooding could affect locations near the River Lim, River Char, River Winniford, Simene River, River Brit, River Asker, River Mangerton and the River Bride.  We will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary.  Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.  People in this area should consider taking action now.  We urge all people to take care and consider activating any property flood reslience products if available.   This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 09/07/24 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Ings Beck, Alverthorpe Beck, Balne Beck, Oakenshaw Beck

items.message: Following overnight rain, river levels in Balne Beck are rising and are expected to reach a level where low-lying land and footpaths adjacent to the river could be affected by flooding. No flooding of property is expected. The rain is expected to ease this afternoon and so water levels should begin to fall from around midday on 9th of July. Please avoid using footpaths next to areas of flooded land and fast flowing water and use alternative routes for walking. This message will be updated by 20:30 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Willow Brook, Evington Brook, Bushby Brook, Thurnby Brook, Scraptoft Brook, Melton Brook, Braunstone Brook

items.message:
River levels are rising at the Leicester Tuffleys Way river gauge as a result of persistent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads is possible from 04:00 today, 09/07/24.  Areas most at risk are low-lying roads and land around the brooks in Leicester City, including recreational land where water depths could become hazardous.  Areas particularly at risk include those around the Braunstone Brook, Lubbesthorpe Brook, Melton Brook, Saffron Brook, Willow Brook, Bushby Brook, Evington Brook, Thurnby Brook and Scraptoft Brook. We do not forecast the situation to deteriorate any further.
Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
To check the status of road closures online, please visit the One Network live map.
This message will be updated by 16:00 today, 09/07/24, or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. Levels have risen on the Upper River Loddon as a result of a period of sustained rain, but have now stabilised and are slowly starting to fall. Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected today 08/07/24, especially in the Sherfield on Loddon area. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours and is likely to be heavy Monday night into Tuesday. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. We are monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 09/07/24, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Forge Mill Reservoir river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall this morning.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible to begin from 9:00 today, 09/07/24.  We expect flooding to affect Upper Tame at Sandwell Valley.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high into Tuesday afternoon, 09/07/24.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast and clearing weed screens.
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 17:00 on 09/07/24, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Water Orton river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall overnight.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this morning, 09/07/24.  We expect flooding to affect Low-lying land and roads between Water Orton and Tamworth including the Bourne Brook at Fazeley.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high into Tuesday afternoon, 09/07/24.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast and clearing weed screens.
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 17:00 on 09/07/24, or as the situation changes.
